links.*: The Hobbit-forming World of J.R.R. Tolkien
The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide

wikitext.*:
'''Interviews with J.R.R. Tolkien''' is a project on Tolkien Gateway to create a chronological list of all known interviews conducted with [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]. *Late [[1955]] or early [[1956]]: "With Camera and Pen" (by Anthony Price; ''Oxford Times'', 27 January 1956){{CG|C}}, p. 483 *[[1955]], [[5 June|June 5]]: : "Oxford Calling" [http://www.nytimes.com/books/01/02/11/specials/tolkien-oxford.html The New York Times] at [http://www.nytimes.com/ www.nytimes.com] (accessed 21 May 2014) *[[1957]]: [[1957 "Carnival of Books" Interview|"Carnival of Books" Interview]] *[[1961]]: [[1961 Jan Broberg|Interview by Jan Broberg]] *[[1961]]: "[[Den besynnerlige professor Tolkien]]" (Interview by Lars Gustafsson) *[[1962]]: Interview by John Bowen ([[12 December]]), for BBC TV's ''Bookstand''.{{CG|C}}, p. 602[http://ftvdb.bfi.org.uk/sift/title/833240 BOOKSTAND: J.R.R. TOLKIEN - INTERVIEW] at [http://www.bfi.org.uk/ BFI.org.uk] (accessed 6 November 2011) *[[1963]]: Interview by Anthony Curtis (?late October—?early November).{{CG|C}}, pp. 610-11 Extracts published in [[The Sunday Telegraph (10 November 1963)|''The Sunday Telegraph'' (10 November 1963)]], [[I, Palantir (April 1964)|''I, Palantir'' (April 1964)]], and [[British Book News (June 1977)|''British Book News'' (June 1977)]]. *[[1964]]: [[1964 BBC Interview]] *[[1965]]: [[1965 BBC Interview]] *[[1966]]: "[[The Hobbit-forming World of J.R.R. Tolkien]]", Henry Resnick, extracts of a more important interview published in 1967 in [[Niekas 18|''Niekas'' Issue 18 (Late Spring 1967)]] *[[1966]]: [[Daphne Castell|Daphne Castell interview]] *[[1966]], [[26 July|July 26]]: "Writers Talking-1: The Hobbit Man", John Ezard, extracts published in (''Oxford Mail'', 3 August 1966). Slightly different extracts from the interview were published in Ezard's article "Tolkien's Shire" (''Weekend Guardian'' 28-29 December 1991){{CG|C}}, p. 670-1[http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=53453 Weekend Guardian.1991] at [http://www.tolkienbooks.net Tolkienbooks.net] (accessed 22 May 2011) *[[1966]]: "Lord of the Hobbits", [[William Cater]] (''Daily Express'', 22 November 1966){{CG|C}}, p. 671 *[[1966]], [[30 November|November 30]]: "[[The Man Who Understands Hobbits]]"{{CG|C}}, p. 681 *[[1967]]: "The Hobbit Man", Philip Norman(''Sunday Times Magazine'', 15 January 1967) *[[1967]]:"[http://www.nytimes.com/1967/01/15/books/tolkien-interview.html The Prevalence of Hobbits]", Philip Norman (''The New York Times Magazine'',15 January 1967){{CG|C}}, pp. 672, 686-7. Apparently the articles are "''similar but not identical''" to "The Hobbit Man".[http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=53610 The Sunday Times Magazine] at [http://www.tolkienbooks.net Tolkienbooks.net] (accessed 22 May 2011) *[[1967]]: "A Benevolent and Furry-footed People" William Foster (''The Scotsman'', 25 March 1967) *[[1967]]: "[http://efanzines.com/Niekas/Niekas-18.pdf#37 An Interview with Tolkien]", Henry Resnick ([[Niekas 18|''Niekas'' Issue 18 (Late Spring 1967)]], 1967) *[[1967]]: "J.R.R. Tolkien Talks about the Discovery of Middle-earth, the Origins of Elvish" (Richard Plotz; ''[[Seventeen]]'', 17 January 1967){{CG|C}}, p. 679{{VT|47}}, p. 30 *[[1968]]: "Fireworks for the Author" (Don Chapman 'Anthony Wood', ''Oxford Mail'', 9 February 1968) *[[1968]]: "In the Footsteps of the Hobbits" (Keith Brace; ''Birmingham Post'', 25 May 1968) *[[1968]]: ''[[Tolkien in Oxford]]'' *[[1972]]: "The Lord of the Legends: A Birthday Tribute to the Creator of The Hobbit", Bill Cater [[The Sunday Times Magazine (2 January 1972)]] *[[1972]]: "An Early History of the Hobbits.” Edinburgh Scotsman (February 5, 1972). *[[1972]]: ?Mid-March: "Tolkien Seeks the Quiet Life in Oxford" (''Oxford Mail'', 22 March 1972){{CG|C}}, p. 760 *[[1972]]: “More and More People are Getting the J.R.R. Tolkien Habit.” Los Angeles Times (April 9, 1972), 14,18 *[[1973]]: Tolkien interviewed about the Oxford Poetry Chair [Oxford Poetry Chair: ITV News 25-05-1973][http://jiscmediahub.ac.uk/record/display/039-00049494 Oxford Poetry Chair] at [http://jiscmediahub.ac.uk jiscmediahub.ac.uk] (accessed 10 December 2013)Tolkien was asked, "presumably you voted for Mr [?]Jennings?"
"What?", replied Tolkien (he didn't hear the question).
"Presumably you voted for Mr Jennings?"
"I did. [inaudible]".
The video then cuts away to black. Presumably this was just a way of introducing the main item. Tolkien is mentioned again and associated with Basil Blackwell as supporting Mr Jennings. ([http://www.facebook.com/groups/TheTolkienSociety.EducationalCharity/permalink/10152072409221068/ The Tolkien Society Facebook group], accessed 14 December 2013) {{references|n}} {{DEFAULTSORT:{{PAGENAME}}}} [[Category:Interviews with J.R.R. Tolkien| ]] [[Category:Index]]
